dict.string: This game was the fastest-selling video game of 2006.
This game allows players to explore and liberate an alien city from the evil, monochromatic INKT Corporation.
The Humans was one of the first video game clones of this game.
4Kids Entertainment produces a computer-animated television series based on this game.
This game's characters act out a Dungeon and Dragons role-playing skit at the end of the credits.
You can shoot lightning bolts out of your eyes as a character in this game.
The hero of this game inhabits a world called Ephinea.
Your character almost dies in Sicily during Operation Husky.
An Action Cam was a new addition in this game.
The Chron-o-John and the Sludge-o-Matic machines are vital in this game's story.
This game won IGN's Best Xbox 360 Strategy Game in 2008.
Golden Keys are part of this game's SHiFT rewards program.
This title spawned three manga adaptions: two anthology volumes and a traditional manga series.
Your character takes part in Operation: Hollow Storm.
This game, the seventh in the series, removed the lead character in favor of having the player create their own.
dict.key: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
dict.string: You have to get your diary back in this colorful title.
In 2009, ScrewAttack named this game the #7 bust on their "Top 10 Biggest Busts."
This game takes you to Paris, Tehran, New York, Oman and many other locations.
The Atlas Corporation and Dahl Corporations make up the story for this game.
dict.key: The Lord of the Rings: War in the North
dict.string: This is the first game in the series to be rated M by the ESRB.
Developed in under 18 months, this game's hero attempts to retrieve a stolen parasitic jellyfish-like organism from Space Pirates.
Your character works for The Order of the Sword.
Writer Orson Scott Card helped write insults used in this game.
Players journey to Rome, Moscow and Taipei in this original and underrated game.
Gameloft released a handheld version of the game for Apple's iOS on May 27, 2010.
This game features an Italian-American hitman for the mafia named Jackie Estacado as the protagonist.
In this game, the main protagonist was a character called Magnus.
Espionage is a way of life in this hit title.
This game earns the title as the first video game ever to be shown at the Tribeca Film Festival.
This game's soundtrack features the song "Sweet Dreams (Are Made Of This)" by Marilyn Manson and "Just Like You" by Three Days Grace.
This science fiction game takes place during the years 2552 and 2553.
dict.key: Call of Duty Black Ops II
dict.string: A Chinese ban on rare earth elements leads to a new Cold War in this game.
Players take on the role of the Stranger in this unique, ground-breaking game.
Katherine Sunday was the assistant to the main character in this title.
This game features a device called the Ray Sphere.
Leonardo da Vinci aids players in this action-packed game.
Earn a maximum of 245 stars in this title!
In this game your character flees to South America and becomes a private security contractor.
This game is set in 1935 in the town of Harley-on-the-Hudson.
Players fight both North Korean and extraterrestrial enemies in this top-rated game.
"Doesn't have one, he was raised in the streets" is a quote during this game's opening.
This game released an expansion pack called Infinite War Battlepack DLC.
This game was inspired by parkour.
dict.key: Rise and Fall of Ancient Empires
dict.string: This 1996 Sierra Online title wasn't able to conquer the competition.
Commercials for the release of this game used the song "Hurt" sung by Johnny Cash in the background.
This game takes place in Bright Falls, Washington.
This game features a fanatical cult known as the Mythic Dawn.
This game follows the journey of Alex Shepherd, a soldier returning from war.
In this game, seven heroes are corrupt, each with a trait representing one of the seven deadly sins.
Shipped with the Aurora toolset, this game now has over 4000 user designed mods.
IGN's PC Game of The Year 2009.
You have the option to play as the Cathar in this title.
You might run into the "Sloth Demon" in this title.
Donning this cover might just bring a curse upon you.
You will discover a monstrous race called grues in this game.
This game allowed divorces to happen to your character.
This title is the second most expensive game in history to be developed.
In 2009, entertainment website IGN named the title the seventh-best PlayStation 2 game of all time.
Feral Interactive released this title on the MAC OS X on March 7, 2012.
dict.key: Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis
dict.string: This game's story was written by Hal Barwood and Noah Falstein.
Considered by many to be the hardest space sim on iOS.
Taking place during a zombie outbreak in Kamurocho was a major departure from the storyline of this series.
In May 2011, Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk gave American President Barack Obama a Collector's Edition copy of this game.
The story behind this title involves asteroid 99942 Apophis that impacts the Earth on August 23, 2029, leaving few survivors.
A comic book mini-series was published by Wildstorm Productions based on the game.
Players start this game returning from an adventure to find their village torched and looted.
A live-action television talk show's parody was produced based on this game.
Author Karen Traviss wrote the story to this game.
Won the 2013 British Academy Video Games Awards for Best Game.
This series has sold over 50 million copies worldwide since its release on March 22, 1996.
This game won 76 awards, including 37 Game of the Year awards.
This game consists of a single 21-level episode, 19 of which need to be completed in order to win the game.
This game, the first in its series, is set in a future where humanity is able to travel through the galaxy quickly using a quantum gateway.
The objective of this title is to guide the nameless, mute, and amnesiac player character through the Neuro Tower to the bottom floor.
This game featured creatures known as Tikis.
Miles Kilo, Jules Merit and Lily Drawl are all characters in this game.
Your character must save your friends who have been captured by pirates.
Take on the role as a regent of a nation in the Land of Anuire in this RTS, adventure game.
The world divided itself into two kingdoms after numerous emerging volcanoes destroyed much of the land in this title.
As of May 2013, this game's sales topped 14.5 million copies.
This game has a separate cooperative campaign that runs parallel to the main campaign called Vendettas.
A limited online beta was launched for this game on September 14, 2011, until September 27, 2011.
Howard Blackwood is the name of the postman in this title.
You can visit Saint Eadric's Mission in this graphically stimulating game.
Exective Producer - Prototype 2The main character in this title is Detective Wei Shen.
It is the first title of its series to include multi-tiered stages and a bound system.
This game is believed to be the first-ever console game sequel.
Players must uncover the secret behind this game's sinister scheme, Protocol 10.
Considered by many tobe the hardest game to play on the Sega Genesis.
There are six possible endings for this Xbox 360 game.
The employees that worked on this title delivered an ultimatum to their bosses: let them make this game or fire them.
Thorn got kissed in this game.
The character Gandohar has named himself Emperor in this title.
This game takes players from Stalingrad to Sicily.
This game was based on the ideas of Objectivism as highlighted by Ayn Rand.
The game was said to have improved graphics and gameplay, with the support of stereoscopic 3D.
Play as a hapless janitor in this title.
As of 2013, there are seven game titles baring this game's name.
This game is the best-selling first-generation Xbox game.
Your character goes to a planet called Osiris where the natives are known as Seers in this game.
In the movie The Wizard, this game was played at the Video Armageddon championship.
This game was the first game to run on the Geo-Mod engine.
Play as a simple and kind Troll in this game.
An article in Eurogamer on August 7, 2006, revealed that Derek Chester collaborated with D.C. Fontana on this game's script.
Comedian Andy Richter voices a character in this title.

dict.string: There were two versions of this game made, Generation Six and Generation Seven.
dict.key: Fester Mudd: Curse of the Gold
dict.string: Never leave home without Martha.

There are over 40 attractions to be played in the differing Zones in this colorful game!
Ever been to Esthar?
At the 2010 Spike Video Game Awards, this game won Game of the Year.
You can sustain T-ENG presence longer in this game due to the warmer climates.
Based on books of the same name by author Andrzej Sapkowski, this game's first title was only available on PC.
Terca Lumireis is the world in which this game takes place.
Your character receives emails from 01001010010101010100111001001111 in this action game.
This game features three modes of play: the field map, a battle mode, and an overworld map.
Let's take a trip down to San Esperito.
Filmmaker Steven Spielberg launched this gaming franchise in 1999.

This game was first announced in the early September issue of the Weekly Shōnen Jump magazine.
This game won IGN's Best of E3 2012 Awards.
Red Falcon Organization is a terrorist group planning to take over the world in this game.
Players take on the role of Prophet in this game set in the year 2047.
This game opens with the player killing giant aliens.
This game won the "Breakthrough Technology Award" and the "Best PC Game Award" at the 2007 Spike Video Game Awards.
This is the first game developed using the newest iteration of Monolith's Lithtech engine. Codenamed "Jupiter EX."

dict.string: The actor who plays this game's lead character, was also involved in the game's production.
The main character of this title embarks on a quest to learn about the Song of Dragons.
This game won Gamespot's "Best Game No One Played" award in 2001.
This game developed with the Pam Engine allowed players to visit more than 25 real world locations.
dict.key: The Lord of the Rings: Conquest
dict.string: Five months after this game's server shut down, a group of fans launched the non-profit CNQReboot servers, allowing its PC players to play online.
The main plot of this title involves characters retrieving scattered pieces of a crashed alien spaceship.
Neo-Venus Construction is helping you this time around…right?
The Sunshine Orphanage is run by the main protagonist in this game.
Your character must liberate the president of a major arms manufacturer in this fun game.
This game was Game Informer's 2012 Game of the Year.
This game takes place over a six-day span in New York City in 1997.
Available mini-games for this title include pachinko, fishing, onsen bath, table tennis, hanafuda and karaoke.
This game came with a realistic Kriegsmarine Grid map.
You can join Caesar's Legion in this game.
This game ran a Facebook competition to get a fan's face in the game by creating a piece of text, video or artwork detailing a kill by its main character.
In 2007, this game was number 47 on GamePro.com's The 52 Most Important Video Games of All Time.
This game takes place in the fictional town of Hope, South Dakota.
This game starts you off in Savannah and then takes you to New Orleans.
Viggo Rolig is introduced in this game.
Ghost Studs assist players in this title.
This game has been described as a spiritual successor to the King's Field series of games.
Run and jump through pages in this game.
Your player is reassigned to a general military unit called Whiskey Company after a falling out with their previous group, the Wolf Pack.
Featuring Master Chin, this game was #10 in GamePro's Top Ten worst games of 2007.
